revised_title: Stability Analysis of Non-Axisymmetric Disturbances in Spiral Flow Between Rotating Cylinders
tldr: The authors conducted a numerical study on the effects of non-axisymmetric disturbances on the stability of spiral flow between rotating cylinders. They found that for low and moderate Reynolds numbers, non-axisymmetric disturbances are the most unstable modes, leading to the formation of helical vortices. The study also extended the stability calculations to high Reynolds numbers, providing a better understanding of the fluid mechanics involved in this phenomenon.
